conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows an angled cutaway with volumetric walls (height + thickness), visible interior spaces, and multiple wall faces (top/side), indicating a true 3D transformation.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D massing: clear wall height/thickness, readable interior volume, clean cutaway and coherent isometric view. Minor simplification/softness in some corner/junction geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning resembles the plan (large living/kitchen zone, central wet-core, bedroom zone), but several layout elements appear shifted/simplified. The right-side stair/run shown in 2D is not clearly present as a stair volume in the 3D model, and some partition proportions/positions do not tightly match.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/island-like elements and bathroom fixtures are partially suggested, but furniture appears inconsistent with the 2D plan (living area reads more like a bed than a sofa/table arrangement), reducing room-identity fidelity.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good contrast and legible openings; interior is visible. Materials are uniform (monochrome), which slightly reduces differentiation between elements but does not obscure geometry.

detected_errors.description: Stair element/volume on the right side of the 2D plan is not clearly modeled as stairs in the 3D render (appears missing or replaced by generic space).
Noticeable discrepancies in internal partition placement/proportions compared to the 2D plan, especially around the central core and right-side zone.
Furniture/room identity mismatch: living area furnishing does not match the 2D plan (sofa/table layout not clearly represented).
Some door/window placements and/or sizes appear simplified and may not align precisely with the 2D plan’s opening locations.

summary: This is a valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric presentation, but it shows notable plan-fidelity issues (especially the stair area and some partitions/openings) and inconsistent furniture-room mapping.
